subject: Real Estate
title: Sovereign Wealth Funds as Landlords
description: A short lesson to help you apply Sovereign Wealth Funds as Landlords.

hook.text: Norway's sovereign wealth fund owns $35 billion in real estate across 800 properties in 15 countries.

buildup.text: Oil-rich nations invest surplus revenue in property to diversify away from fossil fuel dependence.

discovery.text: These funds buy landmark buildings â€” Regent Street in London, Times Square offices in New York.

twist.text: When a sovereign fund owns your office building, your rent check ultimately flows to a foreign government.

climax.text: Sovereign funds are among the largest landlords on Earth, yet most tenants have no idea.

punchline.text: Your landlord might be a country you've never visited.

quiz.question: Why do sovereign wealth funds invest in real estate?
options: To diversify away from fossil fuel dependence
To build housing for their citizens
